intro: Chamaesyce gemella, commonly known as the smallleaf sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and serrated leaves. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Its small, pale yellow flowers bloom in the spring, and the leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs. Chamaesyce gemella is a low-growing perennial that is well adapted to drought conditions.
